result.execSummary:
The defendant Miranda Ann Pedroza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:31 PM Defendant Miranda Ann Pedroza in court.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Miranda Ann Pedroza.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Frank states joint recommendation.  State agrees and includes the witness cost.  Atty Frank agrees with the costs for purposes of resolution.  State makes argument.  Atty Frank makes argument.  DE makes statement.No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1 & 3: Dismissed but read in 

Count 2:

$443.00 fine or costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.
30 Days in Sauk County Jail
23 days jail credit
$121.56 witness fees, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts.

Paperwork handed in court.
Atty Frank received and waives reading of Information.  Enters not guilty pleas.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters not guilty plea(s).  Matter reset.

9:52 AM Defendant Miranda Ann Pedroza in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank in court for Miranda Ann Pedroza.  Prosecuting attorney Rick C Spoentgen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises DE that she still needs to contact the PD's office to have Atty Frank appointed to this case.  Atty Frank is willing to represent DE for today's hearing.  Court finds waiver to be free, knowing and voluntary.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. DE qualifies for PD representation, atty. Ryan Frank represents on prior case(s).
